Their Provider Backbone Bridge (PBB) Equivalents
Abstract
contents.ja: 抽象

contents.text: This document specifies mechanisms for backward compatibility of Ethernet VPN (EVPN) and Provider Backbone Bridge Ethernet VPN (PBB-EVPN) solutions with Virtual Private LAN Service (VPLS) and Provider Backbone Bridge VPLS (PBB-VPLS) solutions. It also provides mechanisms for the seamless integration of these two technologies in the same MPLS/IP network on a per-VPN-instance basis. Implementation of this document enables service providers to introduce EVPN/PBB-EVPN Provider Edges (PEs) in their brownfield deployments of VPLS/PBB-VPLS networks. This document specifies the control-plane and forwarding behavior needed for the auto-discovery of the following: 1) a VPN instance, 2) multicast and unicast operation, and 3) a Media Access Control (MAC) mobility operation. This enables seamless integration between EVPN and VPLS PEs as well as between PBB-VPLS and PBB-EVPN PEs.

1. Introduction
contents.ja: 1. はじめに

contents.text: Virtual Private LAN Service (VPLS) and Provider Backbone Bridging VPLS (PBB-VPLS) are widely deployed Layer 2 VPN (L2VPN) technologies. Many service providers who are looking at adopting Ethernet VPN (EVPN) and Provider Backbone Bridging EVPN (PBB-EVPN) want to preserve their investments in the VPLS and PBB-VPLS networks. Hence, they require mechanisms by which EVPN and PBB-EVPN technologies can be introduced into their brownfield VPLS and PBB-VPLS networks without requiring any upgrades (software or hardware) to these networks. This document specifies procedures for the seamless integration of the two technologies in the same MPLS/IP network. Throughout this document, we use the term "(PBB-)EVPN" to correspond to both EVPN and PBB-EVPN, and we use the term "(PBB-)VPLS" to correspond to both VPLS and PBB-VPLS. This document specifies the control-plane and forwarding behavior needed for 1) auto-discovery of a VPN instance, 2) multicast and unicast operations, and 3) a MAC mobility operation. This enables seamless integration between (PBB-)EVPN Provider Edge (PE) devices and (PBB-)VPLS PEs.

contents.text: The following are the key requirements for backward compatibility between (PBB-)EVPN and (PBB-)VPLS:
contents.ja: 以下は、（PBB-）EVPN及び（PBB-）VPLSとの間の下位互換性のための重要な要件です。

contents.text: 1. The solution must allow for staged migration towards (PBB-)EVPN on a site-by-site basis per VPN instance, e.g., new EVPN sites to be provisioned on (PBB-)EVPN Provider Edge devices (PEs).

contents.text: 2. The solution must not require any changes to existing VPLS or PBB-VPLS PEs, not even a software upgrade.

contents.text: 3. The solution must allow for the coexistence of PE devices running (PBB-)EVPN and (PBB-)VPLS for the same VPN instance and single-homed segments.

contents.text: 6. Support of the All-Active redundancy mode across both (PBB-)EVPN PEs and (PBB-)VPLS PEs is outside the scope of this document. All-Active redundancy is not applicable to VPLS and PBB-VPLS. contents.text: The EVPN PEs MUST advertise both the BGP VPLS auto-discovery (A-D) route as well as the BGP EVPN Inclusive Multicast Ethernet Tag (IMET) route for a given VPN instance. The VPLS PEs only advertise the BGP VPLS A-D route, per the procedures specified in [RFC4761], [RFC4762] and [RFC6074]. The operator may decide to use the same Route Target (RT) to identify a VPN on both EVPN and VPLS networks. In this case, when a VPLS PE receives the EVPN IMET route, it MUST ignore it on the basis that it belongs to an unknown Subsequent Address Family Identifier (SAFI). However, the operator may choose to use two RTs -- one to identify the VPN on the VPLS network and another for the EVPN network -- and employ RT Constrain mechanisms [RFC4684] in order to prevent BGP EVPN routes from reaching the VPLS PEs.

contents.text: When an EVPN PE receives both a VPLS A-D route as well as an EVPN IMET route from a given remote PE for the same VPN instance, it MUST give preference to the EVPN route for the purpose of discovery. Furthermore, all the VPLS-only PEs will discover the EVPN PEs as if they were standard VPLS PEs. In other words, when the discovery phase is complete, the EVPN PEs will have discovered all the PEs in the VPN instance along with their associated capability (EVPN or VPLS-only), whereas the VPLS PEs will have discovered all the PEs in the VPN instance as if they were all VPLS-only PEs.

contents.text: - If a PBB-EVPN PE receives an EVPN IMET route followed by a VPLS A-D route from the same PE, then the PBB-EVPN PE will set up the PW but MUST keep it operationally down.
contents.ja: -  PBB-EVPN PEは、同じPEからVPLS A-Dの経路に続くEVPN IMET経路を受信した場合、その後、PBB-EVPN PEはPWを設定しますが、動作上のダウンそれを維持しなければなりません。

contents.text: - In case VPLS A-D is not used in some PBB-VPLS PEs, the PBB-EVPN PEs need to be provisioned manually with PWs to those remote PBB-VPLS PEs for each VPN instance. In that case, if a PBB-EVPN PE receives an EVPN IMET route from a PE to which a PW exists, the PBB-EVPN PE MUST bring the PW operationally down.
contents.ja: -  VPLS A-Dは、いくつかのPBB-VPLSのPE、PBB-EVPNのPEに使用されていない場合には、各VPNインスタンスのそれらのリモートPBB-VPLSのPEへのPWを用いて手動でプロビジョニングする必要があります。 PBB-EVPN PEはPWが存在したPEからEVPN IMET経路を受信した場合この場合、PBB-EVPN PEは、動作上のダウンPWを持参しなければなりません。

contents.text: - When the PBB-EVPN PE receives traffic over the PBB-VPLS PWs, it learns the associated B-MAC addresses in the data plane. The B-MAC addresses learned over these PWs MUST be injected into the bridge table of the associated MAC-VRF on that PBB-EVPN PE. The learned B-MAC addresses MAY also be injected into the RIB/FIB tables of the associated MAC-VRF on that BPP-EVPN PE. For seamless integration between PBB-EVPN and PBB-VPLS PEs, since these PWs belong to the same split-horizon group as the MP2P EVPN service tunnels, the B-MAC addresses learned and associated with the PWs MUST NOT be advertised in the control plane to any remote PBB-EVPN PEs. This is because every PBB-EVPN PE can send and receive traffic directly to/from every PBB-VPLS PE belonging to the same VPN instance.
contents.ja: -  PBB-EVPN PEは、PBB-VPLSのPWを介してトラフィックを受信すると、データ・プレーンに関連するB-MACアドレスを学習します。 B-MACアドレスは、PBB-EVPN PEに関連するMAC-VRFのブリッジテーブル内に注入されなければならないこれらのPW上に学びました。学習されたB-MACアドレスはまた、BPP-EVPN PEに関連するMAC-VRFのRIB / FIBテーブルに注入することができます。これらのPWSはMP2P EVPNサービストンネルと同じスプリットホライズングループに属しているので、PBB-EVPNとPBB-VPLS PE間のシームレスな統合については、B-MACアドレスが学習およびPWに関連する制御プレーンに広告を出してはなりません任意のリモートPBB-EVPNのPEへ。すべてのPBB-EVPN PEを送信し、同じVPNインスタンスに属するすべてのPBB-VPLSのPEへ/から直接トラフィックを受信することができるからです。

contents.text: - The C-MAC addresses learned over local Attachment Circuits (ACs) by a PBB-EVPN PE are learned in the data plane. For PBB-EVPN PEs, these C-MAC addresses are learned in the I-component of PBB-EVPN PEs and are not advertised in the control plane, per [RFC7623].
contents.ja: -  PBB-EVPN PEによりローカル接続回線（ACS）で学習されたC-MACアドレスは、データプレーンで学習されています。 PBB-EVPNのPEのために、これらのC-MACアドレスは、PBB-EVPN PEのI成分で学習されて、[RFC7623]あたり、制御プレーンでアドバタイズされていません。

contents.text: - The B-MAC addresses learned in the control plane via the BGP EVPN routes sent by remote PBB-EVPN PEs are injected into the corresponding MAC-VRF table.
contents.ja: - リモートPBB-EVPNのPEによって送信されたBGP EVPNルートを介して制御プレーンで学習B-MACアドレスは、対応するMAC-VRFテーブルに注入されます。

contents.text: In case of a link failure in a single-active Ethernet segment, the PBB-EVPN PEs MUST perform both of the following tasks:
contents.ja: 単一活性イーサネットセグメントでリンク障害が発生した場合に、PBB-EVPN PEは、次のタスクの両方を実行する必要があります。

contents.text: 1. send a BGP B-MAC withdraw message to the PBB-EVPN peers *or* MAC advertisement with the MAC Mobility extended community
contents.ja: 1. PBB-EVPNピアにBGP B-MAC撤退メッセージを送る*または* MACモビリティ拡張コミュニティとMAC広告

contents.text: 2. follow existing VPLS MAC Flush procedures with the PBB-VPLS peers
contents.ja: 2. PBB-VPLSピアとの既存のVPLS MACフラッシュ手順に従ってください

contents.text: 4.3. MAC Mobility
contents.ja: 4.3.  MACモビリティ

contents.text: In PBB-EVPN, a given B-MAC address can be learned either over the BGP control plane from a remote PBB-EVPN PE or in the data plane over a PW from a remote PBB-VPLS PE. There is no mobility associated with B-MAC addresses in this context. Hence, when the same B-MAC address shows up behind both a remote PBB-VPLS PE as well as a PBB-EVPN PE, the local PE can deduce that it is an anomaly and SHOULD notify the operator.
contents.ja: PBB-EVPNでは、所与のB-MACアドレスは、リモートPBB-EVPN PEからBGP制御プレーン上またはリモートPBB-VPLS PEからPW上のデータプレーンのいずれかで学習することができます。このコンテキストではB-MACアドレスに関連付けられた移動度はありません。したがって、同一のB-MACアドレスが両方リモートPBB-VPLS PEの背後に示し、ならびに場合PBB-EVPN PE、ローカルPEは、それが異常であると推論することができ、オペレータに通知すべきです。

contents.text: 4.4. Multicast Operation
contents.ja: 4.4. マルチキャスト操作

contents.text: 4.4.1. Ingress Replication
contents.ja: 4.4.1. イングレスレプリケーション

contents.text: The procedures for multicast operation on the PBB-VPLS PE using ingress replication are per [RFC7041] and [RFC7080].
contents.ja: 入力レプリケーションを使用してPBB-VPLS PE上のマルチキャスト動作のための手順は、[RFC7041]及び[RFC7080]あたりです。

contents.text: The procedures for multicast operation on the PBB-EVPN PE for ingress replication are as follows:
contents.ja: 次のように入力レプリケーションのPBB-EVPN PEにマルチキャスト操作の手順は次のとおりです。

contents.text: - The PBB-EVPN PE builds a replication sub-list per I-SID to all the remote PBB-EVPN PEs in a given VPN instance as a result of the exchange of the EVPN IMET routes, as described in [RFC7623]. This will be referred to as sub-list A. It comprises MP2P service tunnels used for delivering PBB-EVPN BUM traffic.
contents.ja: -  [RFC7623]に記載されているようにPBB-EVPN PEは、EVPN IMETルートの交換の結果として、所与のVPNインスタンス内のすべてのリモートPBB-EVPNのPEへのI-SIDごとに複製サブリストを構築します。これは、PBB-EVPN BUMトラフィックを配信するために使用さMP2Pサービストンネルを含み、サブリストAと呼ぶことにします。

contents.text: - The PBB-EVPN PE builds a replication sub-list per VPN instance to all the remote PBB-VPLS PEs. This will be referred to as sub-list B. It comprises PWs from the PBB-EVPN PE in question to all the remote PBB-VPLS PEs in the same VPN instance.
contents.ja: -  PBB-EVPN PEはすべてのリモートPBB-VPLS PEにVPNインスタンスごとに複製サブリストを構築します。これは、問題のPBB-EVPN PEから同じVPNインスタンス内のすべてのリモートPBB-VPLSのPEへのPWを含むサブリストBと呼ぶことにします。

contents.text: - The PBB-EVPN PE may further prune sub-list B on a per-I-SID basis by running MMRP (see Clause 10 of [IEEE.802.1Q]) over the PBB-VPLS network. This will be referred to as sub-list C. This list comprises a pruned set of the PWs in sub-list B.
contents.ja: -  PBB-EVPN PEはさらにMMRPを実行してあたり-I-SIDに基づいてサブリストBをプルーニングすることができるPBB-VPLSネットワーク上（[IEEE.802.1Q]の節10を参照のこと）。これは、このリストは、サブリストB.でのPWの剪定セットを含むサブリストCと呼ぶことにします

contents.text: The replication list maintained per I-SID on a given PBB-EVPN PE will be the union of sub-list A and sub-list B if MMRP is not used and the union of sub-list A and sub-list C if MMRP is used. Note that the PE MUST enable split horizon over all the entries in the replication list, across both pseudowires and MP2P service tunnels.
contents.ja: MMRPであれば、所与のPBB-EVPN PEにI-SIDごとに維持複製リストは、サブリストAとサブリストBの組合MMRPが使用されていない場合と、サブリストAとサブリストCの和集合となり中古。 PEは、疑似回線とMP2Pサービストンネルの両方の間で、レプリケーション一覧内のすべてのエントリ上でスプリットホライズンを有効にする必要があることに注意してください。

contents.text: 4.4.2. P2MP Tunnel: Inclusive Tree
contents.ja: 4.4.2.  P2MPトンネル：込みツリー

contents.text: The procedures for multicast operation on the PBB-EVPN PEs using P2MP tunnels are outside of the scope of this document.
contents.ja: P2MPトンネルを使用して、PBB-EVPNのPEにマルチキャスト操作の手順は、この文書の範囲外です。

contents.text: 5. Security Considerations
contents.ja: 5.セキュリティについての考慮事項

contents.text: All the security considerations in [RFC4761], [RFC4762], [RFC7080], [RFC7432], and [RFC7623] apply directly to this document because it leverages the control-plane and data-plane procedures described in those RFCs.
contents.ja: それは、これらのRFCに記載のコントロールプレーンとデータプレーンの手順を利用しているため、[RFC4761]のすべてのセキュリティ問題、[RFC4762]、[RFC7080]、[RFC7432]及び[RFC7623]は、この文書に直接適用します。

contents.text: This document does not introduce any new security considerations beyond those of the above RFCs because the advertisements and processing of MAC addresses in BGP follow [RFC7432], and the processing of MAC addresses learned over PWs follows [RFC4761], [RFC4762], and [RFC7080].
contents.ja: [BGPで広告およびMACアドレスの処理は[RFC7432]に従うので、この文書では、上記のRFCのものを超えてどんな新しいセキュリティの考慮事項を導入しないと、MACアドレスの処理は、PWSは、[RFC4761]、[RFC4762]に従う上で学んだ、とRFC7080]。
